Description: Fragment of floor of black-figured pottery plate with raised disc at centre; white slipped; interior: lotus and bud frieze around dot and two rings at centre, bounded outside by friezes of dot and roughly drawn zig-zag, separated by pairs of lines; outside white ground with bands fired light red and pale brown.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

From the same vessel as Boston, MFA 88.825 and 88.966 and Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1925.608c (see Walter-Karydi, Samos VI.1, 1973, 139 no. 731, pl. 97.731, erroneously classified as Chian). Özer 2004, 200, classifies the plate as transitional between LWG and black-figure and dates it to 570-60BC. Özer, B. 2004, ‘Clazomenian and related black-figured pottery from Klazomenai: preliminary observations’, in A.Moustaka,E.Skarlatidou, M.-C.Tzannes,Y.Ersoy (Eds), Klazomenai, Teos and Abdera:Metropoleis and Colony,Thessaloniki, 199–219.Özer, B. 2004, ‘Clazomenian and related black-figured pottery from Klazomenai: preliminary observations’, in A. Moustaka, E. Skarlatidou, M.-C. Tzannes,Y. Ersoy (eds), Klazomenai, Teos and Abdera: Metropoleis and Colony,Thessaloniki, 199–219.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 215, no. 45)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 102, pl. XXX, no. 308.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.986)
